results.title: On our own
results.creator_credit: Laurette Deschamps, Kathleen Shannon, Michele Renaud-Molnar, Margaret Pettigrew and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Women have not been encouraged by society to take charge of their lives, either financially or psychologically. In Canada, three out of every five poor adults are women. This film attempts to explain why by singling out two women. One divorced, the other widowed, they found themselves in financial difficulty; neither was trained for wage-earning work. This documentary outlines some of the resources available. A counsellor at the Montreal Women’s Referral and Information Centre emphasizes the need for long-range financial planning.

results.title: On N'enterre Pas le Dimanche = No Funeral on Sundays
results.brief_description:
Philippe, a West Indian student, helps his Swedish girfriend, Margaretha, find a job as a secretary in a publishing house. Philippe has written a novel and the publisher’s wife promise to help with the publishing of the novel in exchange for some special favours from Philippe. Awards: Prix Louis Delluc 1959.

Credits: Director, Michel Drach ; writers, Eric Ollivier, Michel Drach ; photography, Jean Tournier ; music, Eric Dixon, Kenny Clarke.
Cast: Christina Bendz, Philippe Mory, Hella Petri, Albert Gilou, Marcel Cuvelier.

results.title: On my own
results.creator_credit: Antonio Tibaldi, Elisa Resegotti, Les Pescarolo, Rosa Colosimo Productions, Alliance Communications and Ellepi Films
results.brief_description: Simon (Matthew Ferguson), an adolescent at an elite Canadian boarding school, is looking forward to spending his Christmas holidays with his divorced parents. When he arrives in Toronto he discovers that his mother has been hospitalised and, for the first time, is told of her schizophrenia. This intimate drama, shot in the beautiful light of a north Canadian winter, is powerfully acted by Ferguson and by Judy Davis as the mother. Simon’s growing awareness of his mother’s illness results in his alienation from the concerns of his fellow classmates, and he becomes close to an older boy who initiates him into the rites of adulthood. This Australian, Canadian and Italian co-production was nominated for 6 AFI awards including Best Film.

results.title: On Mediterranean shores: Southern Greece
results.creator_credit: John Ferno, Louis De Rochemont and Louis de Rochemont Associates
results.brief_description: Modern Greece, the end product of a civilisation 3000 years old, is a poor country. It is a mountainous peninsula and its towns and cities are scattered along the seacoast and its many islands. The film introduces us to Constantine, a boatowner, who carries cargo between the island and the coastal cities. We follow Constantine on his journey from the island to the coastal cities visiting small villages and Pireus, the port of Athens.

results.title: On guard for thee. Part 1. The Most dangerous spy
results.creator_credit: Donald Brittain, James Littleton, Roger Hart, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The first in a trilogy of one-hour films on Canada’s national security operations and civil liberties during the past half-century. In 1946, Igor Gouzenko, a Soviet cipher clerk in Ottawa, fled his embassy with documents unveiling his nation’s spy network in Canada. It was Canada’s first spy case and confusion reigned in official reaction. Counter-intelligence agencies in the United States and Britain became alarmed at the possible leak of the new atom bomb secrets, so man-hunts soon reached international proportions. In Canada, the government ordered the arrest of many suspected citizens, civil rights were suspended, and the ensuing events became a blot on the nation’s history.

results.title: On golden pond
results.creator_credit: Mark Rydell, Bruce Gilbert and ITC Films
results.brief_description: Cranky 80-year-old retired professor Norman Thayer makes his annual pilgrimage with his wife, Ethel, to their New England summer lake-side home. Their solitude is interrupted, however, when their daughter, Chelsea, arrives with her new fiancee and his son, Billy, in tow. The three generations collide, but after persuading Norman and Ethel to mind Billy, Chelsea and fiancee leave for a romantic European holiday. What begins as a stubborn battle of wills between Norman and Billy, slowly turns into the relationship Norman never had with his own daughter. However, it is through this warm and accepting relationship with Billy that both Norman and Chelsea are finally able to display affection towards one another. Cast includes Katharine Hepburn, Henry Fonda, Jane Fonda, Doug McKeon and Dabney Coleman.

results.title: On camera : The BBC video production course [kit]
results.creator_credit: Mike Crisp, Harris Watts and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: This practical training course for film and video production consists of four videos, each with an accompanying booklet, and a teacher’s guide. 1. ‘The camera’ compares the camera’s view of the world with the human eye, considers focal length and angle of view, outlines the terminology for shot sizes and camera moves, shows how to maintain continuity of direction (34min). 2. ‘Planning a program’ introduces the basic techniques of recording an event on camera, suggesting ways of improving coverage by planning ahead (17min). 3. ‘Interviews’ looks at how to tackle interviews both inside and outside the studio and how to maintain the viewer’s interest (21min). 4. ‘Editing’ introduces principles to guide your selection, order and length of shots and shows how your decisions will affect the way the story is told (20min).
